page.title: 16CARDINHAM CHURCH
page.content: The pews and bench ends are the {original}ones.The carvings are of animals,human heads and even a 3-faced Celtic God.One of the brasses is dated 1777 but the one in the floor to the south of the altar is to Thomas Awmarle 1356-1401.It is the oldest {brass}in Cornwall and unusual as it shows a priest with a sword.All the windows have been replaced since World War 11 when they were damaged by a stray bomb.The east end window is by Webb.It shows Christ in Glory with others dressed in costumes from around the world.The kings letter of thanks is above the north door.It was sent by {Charles 1 in 1643}to thank the parish for its support in the Civil War.
